The claim was published on Facebook by N: s New Conservative Party and has been shared more than 290 times.
The claim includes a text superimposed o: stating that if cattle hoof prints cover more than 50% of a paddock, farmers will now be breaking the law.
The New Zealand Ministry for the Environ: MfE) spokesperson stated that the claim is "not correct" and clarified that the regulations require farmers to meet certain conditions for intensive winter grazing, including hoof prints or pugging that are five centimeters deep or more.
The new National Environmental Standards: with a clause specifying that pugging of any depth must not cover more than 50% of the paddock.
